Description: 4 beats per breath cycle (about 60-90 BPM)
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal, healthy state; harmonious qi and blood
Clinical_Significance: Balanced physiology, no pathology
Associated_Conditions: Health, recovery
Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance, preventive care

Description: 5-6 beats per breath, over 90 BPM, faster than normal
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heat (Excess or Deficiency), Yin deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Heat accelerating blood circulation, fever, inflammation
Associated_Conditions: Infections, fever, inflammation, yin deficiency, hyperthyroidism, anxiety
Treatment_Principle: Clear heat, nourish yin if deficiency heat

Description: 3 or fewer beats per breath, under 60 BPM
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Cold (Excess or Deficiency), Yang deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Cold slowing circulation, weak yang unable to propel blood
Associated_Conditions: Yang deficiency, hypothyroidism, bradycardia, cold conditions
Treatment_Principle: Warm yang, expel cold

Description: 7+ beats per breath, very rapid, over 120 BPM
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Extreme heat, Yang excess, critical condition
Clinical_Significance: Severe heat or yang excess, emergency situation
Associated_Conditions: High fever, severe infection, extreme yang excess, crisis
Treatment_Principle: Strongly clear heat, emergency cooling

Description: Felt with light pressure, weakens with heavy pressure, at skin surface
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Exterior pattern, Wei qi rising to surface to fight pathogen
Clinical_Significance: Pathogen at exterior level, body mounting defensive response
Associated_Conditions: Common cold, flu, exterior wind invasion, early stage illness
Treatment_Principle: Release exterior, expel pathogen

Description: Only felt with heavy pressure, deep below surface
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Interior pattern, internal organ involvement
Clinical_Significance: Pathogen has penetrated interior, or deep-seated chronic condition
Associated_Conditions: Internal organ diseases, chronic conditions, interior cold or heat
Treatment_Principle: Treat interior, address root cause

Chinese_Name: 伏脉 Fú Mài / 闭脉 Bì Mài
Description: Very deep, requires extreme pressure to feel, hidden at bone level
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Extreme cold, severe pain, yang collapse, pathogen deeply hidden
Clinical_Significance: Critical condition, severe interior pathology, or extreme pain
Associated_Conditions: Severe pain, syncope, extreme cold, critical illness
Treatment_Principle: Rescue yang, strongly warm interior, or address severe pain

Description: Thin like a thread, narrow diameter, clearly defined
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Blood and/or Yin deficiency, Qi deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Insufficient blood in vessels, depletion of yin fluids
Associated_Conditions: Anemia, blood loss, chronic illness, yin deficiency, malnutrition
Treatment_Principle: Nourish blood and yin, tonify qi

Description: Wide, broad, takes up large area under fingers
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Excess heat, overabundant qi and blood, or deficiency appearing excess
Clinical_Significance: Vessels expanding with heat or overabundance, or false excess in severe deficiency
Associated_Conditions: High fever, excess patterns, or critical deficiency appearing as excess
Treatment_Principle: Clear excess heat OR strongly tonify if deficiency

Description: Very large and forceful, surges like flooding river, strong at all levels
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Extreme excess heat in qi level, Yang Ming stage heat
Clinical_Significance: Peak of heat, vessels maximally expanded, high fever pattern
Associated_Conditions: High fever, extreme heat diseases, heat stroke, severe inflammation
Treatment_Principle: Strongly clear heat, drain fire

Description: Strong, forceful sensation, pushes back against fingers
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Excess pattern, sufficient zheng qi fighting pathogen
Clinical_Significance: Body has strength to resist, excess condition
Associated_Conditions: Excess heat, excess cold, food stagnation, qi-blood stagnation
Treatment_Principle: Disperse excess, drain or purge depending on pattern

Description: Weak sensation, no force, easily compressed
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Deficiency pattern, weak zheng qi
Clinical_Significance: Insufficient qi and blood, weak body resistance
Associated_Conditions: Qi-blood deficiency, chronic disease, post-illness weakness, yang deficiency
Treatment_Principle: Tonify qi and blood, strengthen zheng qi

Description: Deep, thin, and soft, all three qualities combined, forceless
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe Qi and Blood deficiency, often with dampness
Clinical_Significance: Profound deficiency of qi and blood
Associated_Conditions: Severe anemia, chronic exhaustion, post-hemorrhage, severe illness
Treatment_Principle: Strongly tonify qi and blood, resolve dampness if present

Description: Superficial, thin, and soft, feels like floating cotton
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Dampness with Qi-Blood deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Dampness burdening a deficient body
Associated_Conditions: Damp environment, summer heat-damp, spleen qi deficiency with dampness
Treatment_Principle: Tonify qi, resolve dampness

Description: Diffuse, scattered, irregular, unfocused edges, floating and forceless
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Yuan qi collapsing, kidney essence scattering, critical deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Life-threatening depletion, loss of root, dying pulse
Associated_Conditions: Terminal illness, severe hemorrhage, organ failure, imminent death
Treatment_Principle: Emergency rescue qi, attempt to gather and stabilize essence

Description: Feels like guitar string, straight and long, tense but resilient
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Liver/Gallbladder disorders, pain, constraint, phlegm
Clinical_Significance: Liver qi stagnation, liver yang rising, or pain constraining qi
Associated_Conditions: Liver disease, hypochondriac pain, malaria, pain syndromes, hypertension, stress
Treatment_Principle: Soothe liver, move qi, relieve constraint, stop pain

Description: Feels like twisted rope, taut and forceful, tight tension throughout
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Cold, pain, food stagnation
Clinical_Significance: Cold constricting, or pain causing tension in vessels
Associated_Conditions: Exterior cold, interior cold, acute pain, food stagnation, cramping
Treatment_Principle: Warm and dispel cold, stop pain, resolve stagnation

Description: Superficial, large, and wiry, hollow at center like drum skin, hard on outside empty inside
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Blood loss, essence depletion, pregnancy disorders, spermatorrhea
Clinical_Significance: Severe blood or essence loss with exterior appearance of excess
Associated_Conditions: Hemorrhage, severe blood loss, ectopic pregnancy, miscarriage, essence loss
Treatment_Principle: Stop bleeding, tonify blood and essence urgently

Description: Smooth, flowing like pearls rolling, rounded sensation
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Phlegm, dampness, food stagnation, pregnancy (normal), excess heat in strong person
Clinical_Significance: Excess condition with turbid substances, or normal in pregnancy
Associated_Conditions: Phlegm disorders, indigestion, pregnancy, vigorous health (if no symptoms)
Treatment_Principle: Transform phlegm, resolve dampness, move food; or confirm pregnancy

Description: Uneven, rough, like scraping bamboo or knife on bamboo, arrives irregularly
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Blood stasis, Qi-Blood deficiency, essence depletion, phlegm obstruction
Clinical_Significance: Obstruction or deficiency causing rough flow
Associated_Conditions: Blood stasis, severe blood deficiency, pain, masses, post-hemorrhage
Treatment_Principle: Invigorate blood, nourish blood, remove stasis

Description: Extends beyond normal positions, felt at all three positions and beyond
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Excess heat, strong constitution, or liver fire
Clinical_Significance: Excess yang or heat extending vessels, or healthy if no symptoms
Associated_Conditions: Excess patterns, liver yang rising, athletic constitution if healthy
Treatment_Principle: Clear excess heat, subdue liver yang if pathological

Description: Only felt at guan position, does not extend to cun or chi, abbreviated
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Qi stagnation, severe qi deficiency, or phlegm obstruction
Clinical_Significance: Qi unable to extend pulse, obstruction or severe deficiency
Associated_Conditions: Qi deficiency, qi stagnation, chest constraint, organ problems
Treatment_Principle: Move qi if stagnation, tonify qi if deficiency

Description: Even, regular intervals between beats
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal, healthy rhythm
Clinical_Significance: No rhythm disturbance
Associated_Conditions: Health, stable condition
Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance

Description: Regularly intermittent, skips beats at regular intervals, stops and resumes predictably
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Organ qi exhaustion, wind-stroke, severe trauma, pregnancy complications
Clinical_Significance: Serious organ damage or severe pathology, heart qi deficiency
Associated_Conditions: Heart disease, arrhythmia, organ failure, fright, severe pain
Treatment_Principle: Tonify organ qi, calm spirit, treat underlying severe condition

Description: Slow with irregular skipped beats, pauses unpredictably
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Yin-cold, qi-blood stagnation, phlegm obstruction, masses
Clinical_Significance: Cold or stagnation causing irregular flow
Associated_Conditions: Cold stagnation, blood stasis, masses, tumors, qi obstruction
Treatment_Principle: Warm yang, invigorate blood, resolve phlegm, remove stasis

Description: Rapid with irregular skipped beats, fast but interrupted
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Yang excess, heat with stagnation, qi-blood stagnation with heat
Clinical_Significance: Heat and stagnation combined, yang excess disrupting rhythm
Associated_Conditions: Heat patterns with stagnation, excess yang, heart fire
Treatment_Principle: Clear heat, move stagnation, calm heart

Chinese_Name: 规律不齐 Guī Lǜ Bù Qí
Description: Predictable pattern of irregularity
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Various patterns depending on overall pulse quality
Clinical_Significance: Structural heart issues or chronic rhythm disturbance
Associated_Conditions: Chronic arrhythmias, heart disease
Treatment_Principle: Depends on underlying pattern

Description: Large but hollow in center, feels empty like scallion stalk
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe blood loss, hemorrhage
Clinical_Significance: Blood depleted from vessels leaving hollow sensation
Associated_Conditions: Hemorrhage, severe blood loss, post-trauma, heavy menstrual bleeding
Treatment_Principle: Stop bleeding, strongly tonify blood

Description: Deep, wiry, and forceful, strong and confined at deep level
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Interior excess cold, hernia, internal accumulation
Clinical_Significance: Strong pathogen trapped deeply with sufficient zheng qi to resist
Associated_Conditions: Hernias, internal abscesses, deep cold accumulations
Treatment_Principle: Warm interior, disperse accumulation

Description: Forceful at all levels, strong at superficial and deep, large and powerful
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Excess pattern, strong zheng qi fighting strong pathogen
Clinical_Significance: Full excess condition with robust resistance
Associated_Conditions: Excess heat, excess cold, qi-blood stagnation, constipation
Treatment_Principle: Purge or drain excess depending on nature

Description: Extremely thin and soft, barely perceptible, feels like gossamer
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Collapse of yang qi, critical qi-blood depletion
Clinical_Significance: Life-threatening deficiency, near-death pulse
Associated_Conditions: Shock, severe hemorrhage, yang collapse, dying patient
Treatment_Principle: Emergency rescue qi and yang

Description: Rapid, short, slippery, feels like spinning bean, only at guan position, vibrating
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Fright, pain, pregnancy disorders
Clinical_Significance: Disturbance of spirit or severe pain, kidney qi instability
Associated_Conditions: Severe fright, intense pain, threatened miscarriage, panic
Treatment_Principle: Calm spirit, stop pain, stabilize kidney qi

Description: Combination of minute and weak qualities, deep, thin, soft, barely present
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Severe yang qi collapse, critical qi-blood-yang deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Near-death state, critical deficiency
Associated_Conditions: Terminal illness, severe shock, yang collapse
Treatment_Principle: Emergency tonification and yang rescue

Description: Combination of leather/drum and slippery qualities
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Blood loss with dampness or phlegm
Clinical_Significance: Multiple pathologies present
Associated_Conditions: Complicated gynecological bleeding, blood loss with phlegm
Treatment_Principle: Address blood loss and resolve phlegm-dampness

Description: Position closest to wrist crease
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Heart and Lung (left cun: Heart/SI; right cun: Lung/LI)
Clinical_Significance: Reflects condition of upper jiao organs
Associated_Conditions: Heart, lung, chest conditions
Treatment_Principle: Based on findings in this position

Description: Middle position at styloid process
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Liver and Spleen (left guan: Liver/GB; right guan: Spleen/ST)
Clinical_Significance: Reflects condition of middle jiao organs
Associated_Conditions: Liver, gallbladder, spleen, stomach conditions
Treatment_Principle: Based on findings in this position

Description: Position furthest from wrist crease, proximal
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Kidney (both sides), Bladder, Intestines (left chi: Kidney/BL; right chi: Kidney/Ming Men/SI/LI)
Clinical_Significance: Reflects condition of lower jiao organs and kidney
Associated_Conditions: Kidney, bladder, reproductive, intestinal conditions
Treatment_Principle: Based on findings in this position

Chinese_Name: 尺脉不至 Chǐ Mài Bù Zhì
Description: No pulse felt at chi position on one or both sides
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Kidney essence depletion, kidney qi weakness, lower jiao deficiency
Clinical_Significance: Severe kidney deficiency or life-threatening condition
Associated_Conditions: Kidney failure, extreme kidney deficiency, infertility, impotence
Treatment_Principle: Strongly tonify kidney essence and qi

Chinese_Name: 尺脉有力 Chǐ Mài Yǒu Lì
Description: Forceful pulse at chi, stronger than cun and guan
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Kidney yang excess, lower jiao heat, kidney fire
Clinical_Significance: Excess in lower jiao or kidney
Associated_Conditions: Kidney fire, bladder damp-heat, lower jiao excess
Treatment_Principle: Clear kidney fire, drain lower jiao heat

Chinese_Name: 左右不平 Zuǒ Yòu Bù Píng
Description: Significant difference in quality between left and right wrists
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Imbalance between yin-yang organs, lateralized pathology
Clinical_Significance: Unequal condition between paired organs or sides
Associated_Conditions: Varies by which side and position affected
Treatment_Principle: Balance the affected organs and sides

Chinese_Name: 男性脉象 Nán Xìng Mài Xiàng
Description: Slightly stronger at chi (kidney) position, left slightly stronger
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal male physiology
Clinical_Significance: Reflects normal male qi dominance
Associated_Conditions: Normal health in men
Treatment_Principle: Recognition of normal variation

Chinese_Name: 女性脉象 Nǚ Xìng Mài Xiàng
Description: Slightly softer overall, right may be slightly stronger than left
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal female physiology
Clinical_Significance: Reflects normal female blood dominance
Associated_Conditions: Normal health in women
Treatment_Principle: Recognition of normal variation

Description: Slippery pulse especially at chi positions bilaterally, smooth and rolling
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Pregnancy, especially after 3 months
Clinical_Significance: Increased blood volume and qi nourishing fetus
Associated_Conditions: Normal pregnancy
Treatment_Principle: Nourish blood and qi, support pregnancy

Description: Faster rate (90-120 BPM), softer, more superficial
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal pediatric physiology
Clinical_Significance: Pure yang constitution of children, rapid metabolism
Associated_Conditions: Normal childhood
Treatment_Principle: Recognition of normal pediatric variation

Description: May be slightly irregular, weaker, sometimes wiry from aging
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal aging process, kidney essence decline
Clinical_Significance: Natural decline of yuan qi and essence with age
Associated_Conditions: Normal aging
Treatment_Principle: Tonify kidney essence, support zheng qi

Chinese_Name: 运动员脉 Yùn Dòng Yuán Mài
Description: Slow but forceful (around 50-60 BPM), strong and resilient
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Abundant qi and blood, strong heart
Clinical_Significance: Efficient cardiovascular system, athletic conditioning
Associated_Conditions: Athletic training, strong health
Treatment_Principle: Maintain balance, monitor for overtraining

Description: Slightly wiry quality, like string of musical instrument, resilient
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal spring season, liver qi active
Clinical_Significance: Wood element ascending, liver qi rising naturally
Associated_Conditions: Normal seasonal variation
Treatment_Principle: Recognize normal seasonal quality

Description: Slightly larger, fuller, more flooding quality, superficial
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal summer season, yang qi at surface
Clinical_Significance: Fire element, yang qi expansive and at exterior
Associated_Conditions: Normal seasonal variation
Treatment_Principle: Recognize normal seasonal quality

Description: Slightly superficial and lighter, like floating hair, refined
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal autumn season, yang qi beginning to descend
Clinical_Significance: Metal element, lung qi managing descent
Associated_Conditions: Normal seasonal variation
Treatment_Principle: Recognize normal seasonal quality

Description: Slightly deeper, heavier, more sinking, reserved
TCM_Pattern_Indication: Normal winter season, yang qi stored in interior
Clinical_Significance: Water element, kidney qi storing essence
Associated_Conditions: Normal seasonal variation
Treatment_Principle: Recognize normal seasonal quality
